meanings.definition: Incite or stir up (a feeling or action)
meanings.sent1: The loud noise provokes fear in the small child.
meanings.sent2: His speech provokes excitement among the audience.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy provokes laughter with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected twist in the story provokes curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread provokes hunger in everyone.

meanings.sent1: Her painting provokes admiration from art lovers.
meanings.sent2: The sad movie provokes tears from the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes provokes giggles from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph provokes nostalgia in the elderly man.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset provokes awe in onlookers.

meanings.definition: Cause (a person or animal) to become angry or aggressive
meanings.sent1: The teasing provokes the cat to pounce playfully.
meanings.sent2: The rude comment provokes anger in the student.
meanings.sent3: The persistent buzzing of the fly provokes annoyance in the room.
meanings.sent4: The territorial behavior of the dog provokes aggression in other pets.
meanings.sent5: The unfair treatment provokes resentment in the employees.
